data.title: [tolua]Lua bindings-generator support android-ndk-r9d android-ndk-r10d android-ndk-r10e (win32 support android-ndk-r9d android-ndk-r10d android-ndk-r10e android-ndk-r11c android-ndk-r13b android-ndk-r14b)
data.body:
[tolua]Lua bindings-generator support android-ndk-r9d android-ndk-r10d android-ndk-r10e
(win32 support android-ndk-r9d android-ndk-r10d android-ndk-r10e android-ndk-r11c android-ndk-r13b android-ndk-r14b)

data.title: replaceScene in TouchEventListener of Button Crashes
A bug in Action JumpTo,can't stop at the place we supposed
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.15
- devices test on: win7 x64
- developing environments
   - NDK version: Not Used
   - Xcode version: Not Used
   - VS version: vs2015
   - browser type and version: Not Used

Steps to Reproduce:

```c++
void ActionScene::goCall(Ref * pSender)
{
	auto size = Director::getInstance()->getVisibleSize();
	auto origin = Director::getInstance()->getVisibleOrigin();

	sprite->runAction(JumpTo::create(2,Vec2(origin.x+size.width/2,origin.y+size.height/2),30,5 ) );
}
```
**The code of JumpTo can run correctly when the Botton
 clicked once,but it does't run well when multiple clicked.The sprite can't stop at the place we supposed**

data.title: Why use non-thread safe Spidermonkey

data.body:
If use fopen to need convert utf8 string FileUtils::getSuitableFOpen.
ov_fopen and mpg123_open use fopen.

data.title: [Win32,WinRT] Fix old bag, Manifest not save.
data.body:
Manifest::saveToFile not save, if path contains not asii chars.
std::ofstream not use unicode api.

Now use FileUtils api for write file.

data.title: [Win32,WinRT] Fix listFiles and listFilesRecursively use unicode.
data.body:
1. Incorrect convertation to unicode
if (length != fullpath.size()) correct only ASCII char.
2. For convert unicode exist api, to avoid errors.
3. Equal first char on '.' - error
Need check full name file on "." and "..", otherwise exclude file and
folder begin '.'

Now not use macro UNICODE, for easy use unicode convert api(Otherwise,
need to connect different versions WinRT and Win32 include).

data.title: [WinRT] Fix removeDirectory unicode.
data.body:
CCFileUtilsWinRT::removeDirectory need ut8 string.
temp is wstring(unicode).

data.title: Set camera type accordingly in Camera's init methods
A bug in action, can't stop action at once.
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.15
- devices test on: win7
- developing environments
   - NDK version:
   - Xcode version:
   - VS version:
   - browser type and version:

Steps to Reproduce:
![u84 mv789yia 6e x zq_0](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5201160/25986440/8f0211f2-3722-11e7-8280-8975b9307504.png)

```
    local actionTag = 111
    local seq = transition.sequence({
        cc.DelayTime:create(0),
        cc.CallFunc:create(function()
            self:stopActionByTag(actionTag)
            print("aaa")
        end),
    })
    local action = cc.RepeatForever:create(seq)
    action:setTag(actionTag)
    transition.execute(self, action)
```
output 
```
aaa
aaa
```
this ```aaa``` will be execute twice, but we need only once.

data.title: [Windows]Fix edit box spacing and alignment

data.title: Not stable delta time in default update() method, CADisplayLink duration or timestamp not used?
data.body:
- Cocos2d-x 3.15 and other
 - Devices test on: iPhone 6 and any other

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a simple HelloWorld project and add only `scheduleUpdate(); `
2. Check `delta` from 
```
void HelloWorld::update(float delta) {
    CCLOG("%f",delta);
 }
```

Notice output like this: 

```
0.018591
0.015011
0.017311
0.015939
0.017793
0.015640
0.016709
0.016957
0.017268
0.015884
0.016776
0.016478
0.016699
0.018520
```

For compare, same setup but using **cocos2d-iphone v3**, so Objective C, gives me rock and solid output:

```
0.016720
0.016674
0.016676
0.016675
0.016675
0.016675
0.016707
0.016687
0.016672
0.016677
0.016632
0.016644
```

As result, using cocos2d-x for my game(I ported it from cocos2d-iphone) gives me a different result in terms of image quality. Main character moves quickly and as result image is not so.. clear, nice and smooth as was before in cocos2d-iphone. I'm not talking about jitter or other very noticeable things, but this problem I can clearly identify. And it's really caused by that not stable numbers comes from `update()`.

data.title: AudioEngine Issues in cocos2dx-v3.8.1
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version:   3.8.1
- devices test on:   android7.0
- developing environments
   - NDK version:     ndk-10re
   - VS version:   vs2015
问题： 
1、 以前因为音频无法完美循环问题，根据官方建议把v3.12版本的AudioEngine移植到3.8.1版本下来使用，确实解决了不完美循环的问题，但是现在发现移植后的音频在android7.0机型下卡顿严重甚至播放不出声音！！
2、请问现在3.15版本的AudioEngine模块是否解决了不完美循环和是否在android7.0机型上面会卡顿?
3、如果3.15版本的AudioEngine完全没问题，那么是否有无可能移植到3.8.1版本上使用？
4、如果能够移植，官方有没有移植的具体方案？

备注：以前把v3.12版本的AudioEngine移植到3.8.1版本的移植：#16144

data.title: AudioEngine loops get eventually cut
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.15
- devices test on: iPad
- developing environment: Xcode version:

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Using AudioEgine, play a sound bigger than PCMDATA_CACHEMAXSIZE (1048576) with loop
2. Let the file loop a few times and eventually it will stop looping

The problem seems to be that AudioPlayer::rotateBufferThread will feed the buffer with 100ms of data and sleep for 75ms. If the thread gets delayed a few ms, the decoder will consume all the buffer and stop the sound. Then AudioEngineImpl::update will detect that the sound is stopped and delete the AudioPlayer, ending the loop.

It looks like AudioPlayer::rotateBufferThread is failing to manage all 3 buffers, but I'm not very sure of that (please note that AudioPlayer has 'hardcoded' the buffer count in 3, but there is a define QUEUEBUFFER_NUM that I guess it should be used instead).

A quick fix is to double the data on the buffer to 200ms (#define QUEUEBUFFER_TIME_STEP (0.2f)), or to lower the sleep time on AudioPlayer::rotateBufferThread, although I prefer the first one.

data.title: sprite culling bug when using SpriteFrame
data.body:
-- cocos2d-x version:3.15
-- platform: win32 (i didn't try other platform)
--[[
create a lua project
copy this code to main.lua
run it.
the helloWorld.png will be hide when it close to top of screen
--]] 
------------------------------------
local s = cc.Scene:create()

local spr = cc.Sprite:create("res/HelloWorld.png");
local tex = spr:getTexture();
print(tex)
local sz = spr:getContentSize()
sz.x = 0
sz.y = 0
local sf = cc.SpriteFrame:createWithTexture(tex,sz);
sf:setOffset({x=300,y=-300})
local spr1 = cc.Sprite:create();
spr1:setSpriteFrame(sf)

s:addChild(spr1)
spr1:runAction(cc.RepeatForever:create(cc.Sequence:create(cc.MoveTo:create(3,{x=480,y=960}),cc.MoveTo:create(3,{x=480,y=480}))))

cc.Director:getInstance():runWithScene(s)
print("end")

data.title: [Android] Fix edit box font size and alignment
data.body:
https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/issues/17795

Edit box alignment wasn't resetting the previous value before setting the new one.
Also fixed font size.

Tested on:
Galaxy S8
Nexus 6P
LG G5

![ezgif com-video-to-gif 7](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11037660/25829451/6aaa98d6-3413-11e7-8b25-9b6644deec0c.gif)

data.title: [Android] Edit box text is larger and mis-aligned
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.15
- devices test on: LG G5, Galaxy S8, Nexus 6P
- developing environments
   - NDK version: r10e
   - Xcode version: N/A
   - VS version: N/A
   - browser type and version: N/A

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Start cpp-tests and navigate to "Node:UI"->"GUI Dynamic Create Test"->"EditBox Test"
2. Tap the first edit box. Notice how the font size increases when the edit box is focused.
3. Tap the "Single Line" button next to the first edit box. The text will center align. Now tap the edit box. Notice how the edit box text is now top aligned.
4. Other edit boxes display similar behavior

![ezgif com-video-to-gif 6](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11037660/25829073/4c372ec0-3411-11e7-91d9-2ca88d7da08b.gif)
